intro: Mespilodaphne organensis, commonly known as the Organ Island native, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Organ in the Galápagos archipelago. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the cloud forest ecosystem. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and dark green, while its fruit is a small, round drupe that ripens to a yellowish color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mespilodaphne organensis is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
